content.description: This is the right-hand link-up into the finish of Dust Bowl and Batman. Doesn't really add any significantly cruxy moves.An alternative line forks off before it merges with Batman—this is Alternative Facts.

climbs.name: Nobody Gets Out of Roy Alive

content.description: Deep on the left side of the Mega Roof, start this lowball problem sitting off a little boulder matching a large undercling jug. From here, follow mostly jugs and thread-throughs with a few crimps out the roof to a mantle using a pocket on top of the roof. Really fun moderate roof climbing, keep that butt off the ground!
content.location: Crawl under the far left side of the Mega Roof, this whole problem is a lowball.

content.description: The mega classic of the mega roof. Start as far back as possible on the left side of the cave. Follow easy jugs to a sweet sloper rail and a possible rest where the line meets Batman. Jugs come straight out to a crux with a thin sidepull at the angle change to a ledge. An easy V0 but highball finish up the slab at the end.Walkoff to the left.Very pumpy. Probably better described as ~25 moves of juggy V2 (5.11) horizontal climbing into a V6 boulder problem. = V7?
content.location: Start at back left side of cave.

content.description: The shorter (though certainly not short!), more direct variation of Dust Bowl. Start at back of cave at scooped ledge and follow jugs into this problem.

Starts on Shinjuwan Kogeki on right side of cave, then forks off straight out to a much harder finish.The finish jug broke at some point in 2020/21, the line looks like it still goes but hasn't been sent post-break.
A very large roof with many long problems and some linkups, never getting higher than 7 feet until the lip of the cave.
